timeline.bodyText: Tests for the Instant scheduledTime option are needed as well?
timeline.author: lfgcampos

replies.bodyText:
Good argument! Something I was initially thinking about as well, but decided against because the DeadlineManagerValidator class (used under the hood to actually perform the expectScheduledDeadline... methods) calls the DeadlineManagerValidator#assertScheduledDeadlineMatching(Instant, Matcher<?>) in the DeadlineManagerValidator#assertScheduledDeadlineMatching(Duration, Matcher<?>) method.
Thus, tests which validate the expect methods using Duration, will always end up doing a validation with Instant.
I am assuming this was @m1l4n54v1c initial take on only providing tests for the expect methods using Duration too, hence why I stuck with it too.
Fine with adding the other set though, shouldn't be that big a deal.
Or, maybe @m1l4n54v1c has a changed opinion on this part at the moment, justifying tests for the expect-with-instant methods too.
replies.author: smcvb
